definition: Mt Hua 華山|华山 in Shaanxi/surname Hua
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

sentences.english: The Wall Street Journal gives a daily report of the stock market.
sentences.chinese: 《华尔街日报》每天报告股市行情。

sentences.english: Yule sat behind a desk, reading The Wall Street Journal.
sentences.chinese: 于尔先生坐在办公桌后面看《华尔街日报》。

sentences.english: Inventory is still an issue, according to the Wall Street Journal.
sentences.chinese: 根据华尔街日报，库存清单仍是一个争论点。

sentences.english: News Corp. owns Dow Jones & Co. and The Wall Street Journal.
sentences.chinese: 新闻集团拥有道琼斯公司和《华尔街日报》。

sentences.english: Breast augmentation by transplantation of adipose tissue-derived stem cells was featured in The Wall Street Journal.
sentences.chinese: 隆乳移植脂肪组织源性干细胞是精选华尔街日报。

sentences.english: Yonfan spoke with The Wall Street Journal.
sentences.chinese: 以下是杨凡接受《华尔街日报》采访的内容。

sentences.english: Mr. Sternberg is an editorial page writer at The Wall Street Journal Asia.
sentences.chinese: 作者是《亚洲华尔街日报》社论版作家。

sentences.english: Did the Wall Street Journal misquote him?
sentences.chinese: 难道华尔街日报把他的话引述错误了？

sentences.english: 1889 - The first issue of the Wall Street Journal is published.
sentences.chinese: 1889年的今天，《华尔街日报》创刊号发行。

sentences.english: Did the Wall Street Journal misquote him? Please, please tell me the Wall Street Journal misquoted him.
sentences.chinese: 请，请告诉我华尔街日报把他的话引述错了吧。

definition: Bloomberg (name)/Michael Bloomberg (1942-), US billionaire businessman, politician and philanthropist
to quote/to cite/to recommend (one's friend's, associates etc)
Wall Street, New York/by extension, American big business
South China Morning Post (newspaper in Hong Kong)

pinyin: Mei3 guo2 Quan2 guo2 Guang3 bo1 Gong1 si1
Mei3 guo2 Guang3 bo1 Gong1 si1
